Definition: nnet-test-utils.cc:835
KALDI_ERR
#define KALDI_ERR
Definition: kaldi-error.h:160
void GenerateSimpleNnetTrainingExample ( int32  num_supervised_frames,
int32  left_context,
int32  right_context,
int32  input_dim,
int32  output_dim,
int32  ivector_dim,
NnetExample *  example 
)

Low-level function that generates an nnet training example.

By "simple" we mean there is one output named "output", an input named "input", and possibly also an input named "ivector" (this will be assumed absent if ivector_dim <= 0). This function generates exactly "left_context" or "right_context" frames of context on the left and right respectively.

Definition at line 1154 of file nnet-test-utils.cc.

References GeneralMatrix::Compress(), NnetIo::features, rnnlm::i, NnetExample::io, KALDI_ASSERT, kaldi::RandInt(), kaldi::RandUniform(), and MatrixBase< Real >::SetRandn().

Referenced by UnitTestNnetExample(), and UnitTestNnetMergeExamples().

1161  {
1162  KALDI_ASSERT(num_supervised_frames > 0 && left_context >= 0 &&
1163  right_context >= 0 && output_dim > 0 && input_dim > 0
1164  && example != NULL);
1165  example->io.clear();
1166 
1167  int32 feature_t_begin = RandInt(0, 2);
1168  int32 num_feat_frames = left_context + right_context + num_supervised_frames;
1169  Matrix<BaseFloat> input_mat(num_feat_frames, input_dim);
1170  input_mat.SetRandn();
1171  NnetIo input_feat("input", feature_t_begin, input_mat);
1172  if (RandInt(0, 1) == 0)
1173  input_feat.features.Compress();
1174  example->io.push_back(input_feat);
1175 
1176  if (ivector_dim > 0) {
1177  // Create a feature for the iVectors. iVectors always have t=0 in the
1178  // current framework.
1179  Matrix<BaseFloat> ivector_mat(1, ivector_dim);
1180  ivector_mat.SetRandn();
1181  NnetIo ivector_feat("ivector", 0, ivector_mat);
1182  if (RandInt(0, 1) == 0)
1183  ivector_feat.features.Compress();
1184  example->io.push_back(ivector_feat);
1185  }
1186 
1187  { // set up the output supervision.
1188  Posterior labels(num_supervised_frames);
1189  for (int32 t = 0; t < num_supervised_frames; t++) {
1190  int32 num_labels = RandInt(1, 3);
1191  BaseFloat remaining_prob_mass = 1.0;
1192  for (int32 i = 0; i < num_labels; i++) {
1193  BaseFloat this_prob = (i+1 == num_labels ? 1.0 : RandUniform()) *
1194  remaining_prob_mass;
1195  remaining_prob_mass -= this_prob;
1196  labels[t].push_back(std::pair<int32, BaseFloat>(RandInt(0, output_dim-1),
1197  this_prob));
1198  }
1199  }
1200  int32 supervision_t_begin = feature_t_begin + left_context;
1201  NnetIo output_sup("output", output_dim, supervision_t_begin,
1202  labels);
1203  example->io.push_back(output_sup);
1204  }
1205 }

Definition: nnet-descriptor-test.cc:57
void GetComputationRequest ( const Nnet &  nnet,
const NnetExample &  eg,
bool  need_model_derivative,
bool  store_component_stats,
ComputationRequest *  computation_request 
)

This function takes a NnetExample (which should already have been frame-selected, if desired, and merged into a minibatch) and produces a ComputationRequest.

It ssumes you don't want the derivatives w.r.t. the inputs; if you do, you can create/modify the ComputationRequest manually. Assumes that if need_model_derivative is true, you will be supplying derivatives w.r.t. all outputs.

Definition at line 187 of file nnet-example-utils.cc.

References Nnet::GetNodeIndex(), IoSpecification::has_deriv, rnnlm::i, NnetIo::indexes, IoSpecification::indexes, ComputationRequest::inputs, NnetExample::io, Nnet::IsInputNode(), Nnet::IsOutputNode(), KALDI_ERR, NnetIo::name, IoSpecification::name, ComputationRequest::need_model_derivative, ComputationRequest::outputs, and ComputationRequest::store_component_stats.

Referenced by NnetLdaStatsAccumulator::AccStats(), NnetComputerFromEg::Compute(), NnetComputeProb::Compute(), and NnetTrainer::Train().

192  request->inputs.clear();

194  request->outputs.clear();
195  request->outputs.reserve(eg.io.size());
196  request->need_model_derivative = need_model_derivative;
197  request->store_component_stats = store_component_stats;

201  int32 node_index = nnet.GetNodeIndex(name);
202  if (node_index == -1 &&
203  !nnet.IsInputNode(node_index) && !nnet.IsOutputNode(node_index))
204  KALDI_ERR << "Nnet example has input or output named '" << name
205  << "', but no such input or output node is in the network.";
206

208  nnet.IsInputNode(node_index) ? request->inputs : request->outputs;

214  }
215  // check to see if something went wrong.
216  if (request->inputs.empty())
217  KALDI_ERR << "No inputs in computation request.";

222  << submat.num_rows << " rows, but you access row "
223  << row_index;
224  }

226  os << 'm' << submat.matrix_index << '(' << row << ",:)";

230  }

Definition: kaldi-error.h:143
static NnetComputation::SubMatrixInfo kaldi::nnet3::GetSubMatrixOfSubMatrix ( const NnetComputation &  computation,
int32  submat_a,
int32  submat_b 
)
static

This static function returns a SubMatrixInfo corresponding to replacing the matrix-index in a's "matrix_index" with, essentially, sub-matrix b.

Of course the matrix_index will be b's "matrix_index", but we may have to modify the row and column offsets. The idea is that sub-matrix submat_b should have the same dimensions as the matrix underlying submat_a.

Definition at line 773 of file nnet-optimize-utils.cc.

References NnetComputation::SubMatrixInfo::col_offset, KALDI_ASSERT, NnetComputation::matrices, NnetComputation::SubMatrixInfo::matrix_index, NnetComputation::MatrixInfo::num_cols, NnetComputation::SubMatrixInfo::num_cols, NnetComputation::MatrixInfo::num_rows, NnetComputation::SubMatrixInfo::num_rows, NnetComputation::SubMatrixInfo::row_offset, and NnetComputation::submatrices.

Referenced by VariableMergingOptimizer::DoLeftMerge(), and VariableMergingOptimizer::DoRightMerge().

774  {
775  KALDI_ASSERT(static_cast<size_t>(submat_a) < computation.submatrices.size());
776  KALDI_ASSERT(static_cast<size_t>(submat_b) < computation.submatrices.size());
777  const NnetComputation::SubMatrixInfo &a = computation.submatrices[submat_a],
778  &b = computation.submatrices[submat_b];
779  const NnetComputation::MatrixInfo &a_mat =
780  computation.matrices[a.matrix_index];
781  KALDI_ASSERT(a_mat.num_rows == b.num_rows && a_mat.num_cols == b.num_cols);
782  NnetComputation::SubMatrixInfo ans;
783  ans.matrix_index = b.matrix_index;
784  ans.row_offset = a.row_offset + b.row_offset;
785  ans.num_rows = a.num_rows;
786  ans.col_offset = a.col_offset + b.col_offset;
787  ans.num_cols = a.num_cols;
788  return ans;
789 }
KALDI_ASSERT
#define KALDI_ASSERT(cond)
Definition: kaldi-error.h:143
bool HasContiguousProperty ( const std::vector< int32 > &  indexes,
std::vector< std::pair< int32, int32 > > *  reverse_indexes 
)

This function returns true if for each integer i != -1, all the indexes j at which indexes[j] == i are consecutive with no gaps (more formally: if j1 < j2 < j3 and indexes[j1] != -1 and indexes[j1] == indexes[j3], then indexes[j1] == indexes[j2]).

For example, the vector [ 1 2 1 ] lacks the contiguous property because 1 appears in two places with a different number in the middle. If the vector has the contiguous property, this function also outputs to "reverse_indexes" the begin and end of these ranges, so that indexes[j] == i for all j such that (*reverse_indexes)[i].first <= j && j < (*reverse_indexes)[i].second.

Definition at line 523 of file nnet-compile-utils.cc.

References rnnlm::i, rnnlm::j, KALDI_ASSERT, and KALDI_WARN.

Referenced by Compiler::DoBackwardComputationFromIndexes(), UnitTestEnsureContiguousProperty(), and UnitTestHasContiguousProperty().

525  {
526  reverse_indexes->clear();
527  int32 num_indexes = indexes.size();
528  if (num_indexes == 0)
529  return true;
530  int32 num_input_indexes =
531  *std::max_element(indexes.begin(), indexes.end()) + 1;
532  KALDI_ASSERT(num_input_indexes >= 0);
533  if (num_input_indexes == 0) {
534  // we don't really expect this input, filled with -1's.
535  KALDI_WARN << "HasContiguousProperty called on vector of -1's.";
536  return true;
537  }
538  reverse_indexes->resize(num_input_indexes,
539  std::pair<int32,int32>(-1, -1));
540  // set each pair's "first" to the min index of all elements
541  // of "indexes" with that value, and the "second" to the
542  // max plus one.
543  for (int32 i = 0; i < num_indexes; i++) {
544  int32 j = indexes[i];
545  if (j == -1) continue;
546  KALDI_ASSERT(j >= 0);
547  std::pair<int32, int32> &pair = (*reverse_indexes)[j];
548  if (pair.first == -1) {
549  pair.first = i;
550  pair.second = i + 1;
551  } else {
552  pair.first = std::min(pair.first, i);
553  pair.second = std::max(pair.second, i + 1);
554  }
555  }
556  // check that the contiguous property holds.
557  for (int32 i = 0; i < num_input_indexes; i++) {
558  std::pair<int32, int32> pair = (*reverse_indexes)[i];
559  if (pair.first != -1) {
560  for (int32 j = pair.first; j < pair.second; j++)
561  if (indexes[j] != i)
562  return false;
563  }
564  }
565  return true;
566 }
rnnlm::j
int j

)

This function outputs to "matrix_args" the addresses of a subset of the arguments arg1 through arg6 in commands in "commands", that correspond to the indexes of matrices.

Definition: nnet-computation.h:203
void IdentifyMatrixArgsInComputation ( bool  include_from_submatrices,
NnetComputation *  computation,
std::vector< int32 * > *  matrix_args 
)

This function outputs to "matrix_args" the addresses of indexes inside 'computation' that correspond to matrices.

These live inside computation->commands and computation->input_output_info; and if 'include_from_submatrices' is true, then the matrix-indexes present in computation->submatrices[*].matrix_index will be included too. Zeros may be present if there were optional arguments; we do include pointers to them, but you can just ignore them.

Definition at line 105 of file nnet-optimize-utils.cc.

References NnetComputation::commands, IdentifyMatrixArgs(), NnetComputation::input_output_info, and NnetComputation::submatrices.

111  (include_in_submatrices ?
112  computation->submatrices.size() : 0) +
113  2 * computation->input_output_info.size());
114  if (include_in_submatrices)
115  for (int32 s = 1; s < num_submatrices; s++)

Definition: nnet-optimize-utils.cc:75
void IdentifySubmatrixArgsInComputation ( NnetComputation *  computation,
std::vector< int32 * > *  submatrix_args 
)

This function outputs to "submatrix_args" the addresses of integers in 'computation' that correspond to submatrices.

These may be present in 'commands', and in 'indexes_multi'. This is useful in renumbering code. Note: some of the pointers may point to a zero value, for optional submatrix args in commands, but for efficiency we don't provide pointers for the -1's in 'indexes_multi'.

Definition at line 230 of file nnet-optimize-utils.cc.

References NnetComputation::commands, rnnlm::i, IdentifySubmatrixArgs(), and NnetComputation::indexes_multi.

235  for (size_t i = 0; i < computation->indexes_multi.size(); i++)
236  extra_size += computation->indexes_multi[i].size();
237  submatrix_args->reserve(submatrix_args->size() + extra_size);
238

Definition: mikolov-rnnlm-lib.cc:66
static void kaldi::nnet3::IndexesMultiToSubmatrixIndexes ( const std::vector< std::pair< int32, int32 > > &  indexes_multi,
std::vector< int32 > *  submatrix_indexes 
)
static

given a vector of pairs from computation.indexes_multi_indexes containing paris (submatrix-index, row-index), this function outputs to "submatrix_indexes" all (unique) submatrix indexes that appear; and it outputs to "contains_null_marker" true if the pair (-1, -1) appears anywhere in indexes_multi, and false otherwise.

Definition at line 247 of file nnet-analyze.cc.

References kaldi::SortAndUniq().

Referenced by ComputeCommandAttributes().

249  {
250  submatrix_indexes->clear();
251  std::vector<std::pair<int32, int32> >::const_iterator
252  iter = indexes_multi.begin(), end = indexes_multi.end();
253  int32 cur_submatrix_index = -1; // an optimization.
254  for (; iter != end; ++iter) {
255  int32 submatrix_index = iter->first;
256  if (submatrix_index != -1 && submatrix_index != cur_submatrix_index) {
257  cur_submatrix_index = submatrix_index;
258  submatrix_indexes->push_back(submatrix_index);
259  }
260  }

bool IsSimpleNnet ( const Nnet &  nnet)

This function returns true if the nnet has the following properties: It has one output, called "output".

It has an input called "input", and possibly an extra input called "ivector", but no other inputs. There are probably some other properties that we really ought to be checking, and we may add more later on.

Definition at line 42 of file nnet-utils.cc.

References Nnet::GetNodeIndex(), Nnet::IsInputNode(), Nnet::IsOutputNode(), NumInputNodes(), and NumOutputNodes().

Referenced by ComputeExampleComputationRequestSimple(), ComputeSimpleNnetContext(), NnetDecodableBase::NnetDecodableBase(), NnetInfo(), and AmNnetSimple::SetContext().

42  {
43  // check that we have just one output node and it is
44  // called "output".
45  if (NumOutputNodes(nnet) != 1 ||
46  nnet.GetNodeIndex("output") == -1 ||
47  !nnet.IsOutputNode(nnet.GetNodeIndex("output")))
48  return false;
49  // check that there is an input node named "input".
50  if (nnet.GetNodeIndex("input") == -1 ||
51  !nnet.IsInputNode(nnet.GetNodeIndex("input")))
52  return false;
53  // if there was just one input, then it was named
54  // "input" and everything checks out.
55  if (NumInputNodes(nnet) == 1)
56  return true;
57  // Otherwise, there should be 2 inputs and one
58  // should be called "ivector".
59  return NumInputNodes(nnet) == 2 &&
60  nnet.GetNodeIndex("ivector") != -1 &&
61  nnet.IsInputNode(nnet.GetNodeIndex("ivector"));
62 }

Definition: kaldi-vector.h:59
void kaldi::nnet3::LimitDerivativeTimes ( const Nnet &  nnet,
const ComputationRequest &  request,
const NnetOptimizeOptions &  opts,
NnetComputation *  computation 
)

This optimization, which has no effect unless you set –min-deriv-time or –max-deriv-time, modifies the backprop operations for efficiency based on the assumption that derivatives for any Cindex with t < min_deriv_time or t > max_deriv_time are zero.

(this is based on the fact that derivatives in recurrent setups will either decay to zero over time, or will explode and anyway become meaningless). This is only applied if you are not comoputing any input-derivatives). The assumption, for simple Components, is that backprop operations are no-ops as long as the input was zeroed, because the back-propagated derivatives would be zero and the model would not be updated.

The most important effect of this operation is to modify some operations of type kBackprop and kBackpropNoModelUpdate for simple Components, to either make them operate on row ranges of their original input (which in general will be newly created submatrices), or to remove them altogether if they do not operate on any 't' values within the correct range.

We assert as a requirement of this optimization that all allocation commands must zero their matrices (this effectively means that you cannot apply this optimization after RemoveUnnecessaryZeroing()). This means that we don't have to worry about leaving things undefined after removing backprop operations. We also assert that backprop commands that set instead of adding to their input, must not be outputting to things that were previously set to nonzero values. (this shouldn't ever be a problem, but we do check.

Note: after this optimization it will likely be beneficial to call RemoveUnnecessaryOperations to remove operations not of type kBackprop that have now become unnecessary– e.g. operations that do the backprop through Descriptors.

void LimitDerivativeTimes ( const Nnet &  nnet,
int32  min_deriv_time,
int32  max_deriv_time,
NnetComputation *  computation 
)

Definition at line 1805 of file nnet-optimize-utils.cc.

References DerivativeTimeLimiter::LimitDerivTimes().

Referenced by Optimize().

1808  {

1810  computation);
1811  limiter.LimitDerivTimes();
1812 }

std::vector< std::vector< int32 > > *  scc_graph 
)

Given a list of sccs of a graph (e.g.

as computed by FindSccs), compute a directed graph on the sccs. Of course this directed graph will be acyclic.

170 
171  // Hash map from node to SCC index.
172  std::vector<int32> node_to_scc_index(graph.size());
173  for (int32 i = 0; i < sccs.size(); ++i) {
174  for (int32 j = 0; j < sccs[i].size(); ++j) {
175  KALDI_ASSERT(sccs[i][j] >= 0 && sccs[i][j] < graph.size());

177  }

187  (*scc_graph)[i].push_back(node_to_scc_index[graph[node][k]]);
188  }
189  }
190  }
191  // If necessary, we can use a hash maps to avoid this sorting.

bool  compress,
NnetExample *  dest 
)

Merge a set of input examples into a single example (typically the size of "src" will be the minibatch size).

Will crash if "src" is the empty vector. If "compress" is true, it will compress any non-sparse features in the output.

void MoveSizingCommands ( const Nnet &  nnet,
NnetComputation *  computation 
)

This optimization moves commands that initialize matrices to as late as possible, and commands that empty matrices to as early as possible.

Definition at line 28 of file nnet-optimize.cc.

References MatrixAccesses::accesses, MatrixAccesses::allocate_command, NnetComputation::commands, ComputeCommandAttributes(), ComputeMatrixAccesses(), ComputeVariableAccesses(), MatrixAccesses::deallocate_command, ComputationVariables::Init(), and KALDI_ASSERT.

Referenced by Optimize().

28  {
29  ComputationVariables variables;
30  variables.Init(*computation);
31  std::vector<CommandAttributes> attributes;
32  ComputeCommandAttributes(nnet, *computation, variables, &attributes);
33  std::vector<std::vector<Access> > variable_accesses;
34  ComputeVariableAccesses(variables, attributes, &variable_accesses);
35  std::vector<MatrixAccesses> matrix_accesses;
36  ComputeMatrixAccesses(nnet, *computation, variables, attributes,
37  &matrix_accesses);
38 
39  // The way we will renumber the commands is, we will first set this vector up
40  // with pairs (command-index * 3, pointer-to-command), and we will then modify
41  // the command-indexes in this vector to the numbers that we want, and sort
42  // it. The reason for the * 3 is so that we can number commands "just-after"
43  // existing indexes (by adding 1) and "just-before" (by subtracting 1).
44  int32 num_commands = computation->commands.size(),
45  num_matrices = matrix_accesses.size();
46  std::vector<std::pair<int32,NnetComputation::Command*> >
47  commands(num_commands);
48  for (int32 c = 0; c < num_commands; c++) {
49  commands[c].first = c * 3;
50  commands[c].second = &(computation->commands[c]);
51  }
52  for (int32 m = 1; m < num_matrices; m++) {
53  const MatrixAccesses &ma = matrix_accesses[m];
54  if (ma.allocate_command != -1) {
55  // first_access_command will be index of first non-initializing access.
56  int32 first_access_command = -1;
57  if (!ma.accesses.empty()) {
58  first_access_command = ma.accesses[0].command_index;
59  if (first_access_command == ma.allocate_command) {
60  if (ma.accesses.size() > 1)
61  first_access_command = ma.accesses[1].command_index;
62  else
63  first_access_command = -1;
64  }
65  }
66  if (first_access_command != -1) {
67  KALDI_ASSERT(first_access_command > ma.allocate_command);
68  // move the initialization command to just before the first access.
69  commands[ma.allocate_command].first = first_access_command * 3 - 1;
70  }
71  }
72  if (ma.deallocate_command != -1) {
73  if (!ma.accesses.empty()) {
74  int32 last_access_command = ma.accesses.back().command_index;
75  // move the destruction command to just after the last access.
76  commands[ma.deallocate_command].first = last_access_command * 3 + 1;
77  }
78  }
79  }
80  std::sort(commands.begin(), commands.end());
81  std::vector<NnetComputation::Command> reordered_commands(num_commands);
82  for (int32 c = 0; c < num_commands; c++)
83  reordered_commands[c] = *(commands[c].second);
84  computation->commands = reordered_commands;
85 }

std::string NnetInfo ( const Nnet &  nnet)

This function returns various info about the neural net.

If the nnet satisfied IsSimpleNnet(nnet), the info includes "left-context=5\nright-context=3\n...". The info includes the output of nnet.Info(). This is modeled after the info that AmNnetSimple returns in its Info() function (we need this in the CTC code).

bool NnetParametersAreIdentical ( const Nnet &  nnet1,
const Nnet &  nnet2,
BaseFloat  threshold 
)

Used for testing that the updatable parameters in two networks are the same.

May crash if structure differs. Prints warning and returns false if parameters differ. E.g. set threshold to 1.0e-05 (it's a relative threshold, applied per component).

1135  *u2 = dynamic_cast<const UpdatableComponent*>(c2);

1142  std::min(prod21, prod22));

1145  << "' differs in nnet1 versus nnet2: prod(11,12,21,22) = "
1146  << prod11 << ',' << prod12 << ',' << prod21 << ',' << prod22;
1147  return false;

1149  }

#define KALDI_ASSERT(cond)
Definition: kaldi-error.h:143
void NnetToDirectedGraph ( const Nnet &  nnet,
std::vector< std::vector< int32 > > *  graph 
)

This function takes an nnet and turns it to a directed graph on nodes.

The nodes will be numbered from 0 to graph->size() - 1, where graph->size() == nnet.NumNodes(). For each node-index n, the vector in (*graph)[n] will contain a list of all the nodes that have a direct dependency on node n (in order to compute them). For instance, if n is an input node, (*graph)[n] will be the empty list because it won't depend on anything.

Definition at line 30 of file nnet-graph.cc.

References NetworkNode::descriptor, Nnet::GetNode(), Descriptor::GetNodeDependencies(), rnnlm::i, KALDI_ASSERT, KALDI_ERR, kComponent, kDescriptor, kDimRange, kInput, rnnlm::n, NetworkNode::node_index, NetworkNode::node_type, Nnet::NumNodes(), kaldi::SortAndUniq(), and NetworkNode::u.

Referenced by ComputeNnetComputationEpochs().

31  {
32  graph->clear();
33  int32 num_nodes = nnet.NumNodes();
34  graph->resize(num_nodes);
35  for (int32 n = 0; n < num_nodes; n++) {
36  const NetworkNode &node = nnet.GetNode(n);
37  // handle dependencies of this node.
38  std::vector<int32> node_dependencies;
39  switch (node.node_type) {
40  case kInput:
41  break; // no node dependencies.
42  case kDescriptor:
43  node.descriptor.GetNodeDependencies(&node_dependencies);
44  break;
45  case kComponent:
46  node_dependencies.push_back(n - 1);
47  break;
48  case kDimRange:
49  node_dependencies.push_back(node.u.node_index);
50  break;
51  default:
52  KALDI_ERR << "Invalid node type";
53  }
54  SortAndUniq(&node_dependencies);
55  for (size_t i = 0; i < node_dependencies.size(); i++) {
56  int32 dep_n = node_dependencies[i];
57  KALDI_ASSERT(dep_n >= 0 && dep_n < num_nodes);
58  (*graph)[dep_n].push_back(n);
59  }

bool ParseFromString ( const std::string &  name,
std::string *  string,
int32 *  param 
)

Function used in Init routines.

Suppose name=="foo", if "string" has a field like foo=12, this function will set "param" to 12 and remove that element from "string". It returns true if the parameter was read.

246  {
247  std::vector<std::string> split_string;
248  SplitStringToVector(*string, " \t", true,
249  &split_string);
250  std::string name_equals = name + "="; // the name and then the equals sign.
251  size_t len = name_equals.length();
252 
253  for (size_t i = 0; i < split_string.size(); i++) {
254  if (split_string[i].compare(0, len, name_equals) == 0) {
255  std::string b = split_string[i].substr(len);
256  if (b.empty())
257  KALDI_ERR << "Bad option " << split_string[i];
258  if (b[0] == 'f' || b[0] == 'F') *param = false;
259  else if (b[0] == 't' || b[0] == 'T') *param = true;
260  else
261  KALDI_ERR << "Bad option " << split_string[i];
262  *string = "";
263  // Set "string" to all the pieces but the one we used.
264  for (size_t j = 0; j < split_string.size(); j++) {
265  if (j != i) {
266  if (!string->empty()) *string += " ";

268  }
269  }
270  return true;
271  }
272  }
273  return false;
274 }

29  {
30  if (*token_ptr == "end of input")
31  return "";
32  std::string next_few_tokens = ", next part of line is: ";
33  // in the next line, *token_ptr should never equal "" but it's to mitigate the
34  // effect of bugs where we read past the end of the array.
35  while (*token_ptr != "end of input" && *token_ptr != "" &&
36  next_few_tokens.size() < 40) {
37  next_few_tokens = (next_few_tokens + " ") + *token_ptr;
38  token_ptr++;
39  }
40  if (*token_ptr != "end of input")
41  next_few_tokens = next_few_tokens + " ...";
42  return next_few_tokens;
43 }

KALDI_ASSERT
#define KALDI_ASSERT(cond)
Definition: kaldi-error.h:143
void PrintCindexes ( std::ostream &  ostream,
const std::vector< Cindex > &  cindexes,
const std::vector< std::string > &  node_names 
)

this will only be used for pretty-printing.

It prints a vector of Cindexes in a compact, human-readable way with compression of ranges. If the values of the node indexes are the same for the entire vector, it will just be node-name followed by the output of PrintIndexes, e.g. some_node[ (1,1,0) ]. Otherwise it will divide the vector into ranges that each have all the same node name, and will print out each range in the way we just mentioned. 'node_names' will usually come from a call like nnet.GetNodeNames().

Definition at line 232 of file nnet-common.cc.

References KALDI_ASSERT, and PrintIndexes().

Referenced by PrintComputationPreamble().

234  {
235  int32 num_cindexes = cindexes.size();
236  if (num_cindexes == 0) {
237  ostream << "[ ]";
238  return;
239  }
240  int32 cur_offset = 0;
241  std::vector<Index> indexes;
242  indexes.reserve(cindexes.size());
243  while (cur_offset < num_cindexes) {
244  int32 cur_node_index = cindexes[cur_offset].first;
245  while (cur_offset < num_cindexes &&
246  cindexes[cur_offset].first == cur_node_index) {
247  indexes.push_back(cindexes[cur_offset].second);
248  cur_offset++;
249  }
250  KALDI_ASSERT(static_cast<size_t>(cur_node_index) < node_names.size());
251  const std::string &node_name = node_names[cur_node_index];
252  ostream << node_name;
253  PrintIndexes(ostream, indexes);
254  indexes.clear();
255  }
256 }

250  switch (c.command_type) {
251  case kAllocMatrixZeroed:
252  os << "m" << c.arg1 << " = zeros("
253  << computation.matrices[c.arg1].num_rows
254  << ',' << computation.matrices[c.arg1].num_cols << ")\n";

262  os << "m" << c.arg1 << " = []\n";
263  break;
264  case kAllocMatrixFromOther:
265  os << "m" << c.arg1 << ".swap(m" << c.arg2 << ") [dim = "
266  << computation.matrices[c.arg1].num_rows << " x "
267  << computation.matrices[c.arg1].num_cols << "]\n";
268  break;
269  case kAllocMatrixFromOtherZeroed:

285  break;
286  case kBackprop:
287  case kBackpropNoModelUpdate: {
288  int32 component_index = c.arg1;
289  os << nnet.GetComponentName(component_index) << ".Backprop(";
290  if (c.arg2 == 0) os << "NULL, ";
291  else os << "precomputed_indexes[" << c.arg2 << "], ";
292  os << submatrix_strings[c.arg3] << ", "
293  << submatrix_strings[c.arg4] << ", "
294  << submatrix_strings[c.arg5] << ", "
295  << (computation.need_model_derivative &&
296  c.command_type == kBackprop ?
297  "[component-pointer], " : "NULL, ")
298  << (c.arg6 == 0 ? std::string("NULL") :
299  std::string("&") + submatrix_strings[c.arg6]) << ")\n";
300  break;
301  }
302  case kMatrixCopy:
303  os << submatrix_strings[c.arg1] << " = "
304  << submatrix_strings[c.arg2] << "\n";
305  break;
306  case kMatrixAdd:
307  os << submatrix_strings[c.arg1] << " += "
308  << submatrix_strings[c.arg2] << "\n";
309  break;
310  case kAddRows:
311  case kCopyRows:
312  os << submatrix_strings[c.arg1] << "."
313  << (c.command_type == kAddRows ? "AddRows" :
314  "CopyRows") << "(" << submatrix_strings[c.arg2]
315  << indexes_strings[c.arg3] << ")\n";
316  break;
317  case kAddRowsMulti:
318  case kAddToRowsMulti:
319  case kCopyRowsMulti:
320  case kCopyToRowsMulti: {
321  CommandType ct = c.command_type;
322  os << submatrix_strings[c.arg1] << "."
323  << (ct == kAddRowsMulti ? "AddRowsMulti" :
324  (ct == kAddToRowsMulti? "AddToRowsMulti" :
325  (ct == kCopyRowsMulti ? "CopyRowsMulti" :
326  "CopyToRowsMulti"))) << "("
327  << indexes_multi_strings[c.arg2] << ")\n";
328  break;

335  for (size_t i = 0; i < pairs.size(); i++) {
336  os << pairs[i].first << ":" << (pairs[i].second - 1);
337  if (i + 1 < pairs.size()) os << ",";
338  }
339  os << "])\n";
340  break;
341  }
342  case kNoOperation:
343  os << "[no-op]\n";
344  break;
345  case kNoOperationMarker:
346  os << "# begin backward commands\n";
347  break;
348  default:
349  KALDI_ERR << "Un-handled command type.";
350  }

rnnlm::i
int i
Definition: mikolov-rnnlm-lib.cc:66
void PrintIndexes ( std::ostream &  ostream,
const std::vector< Index > &  indexes 
)

this will only be used for pretty-printing.

It prints a vector of Indexes in a compact, human-readable way with compression of ranges (it also doesn't print the x index if it's 1.0. Example output: "[ (1,1:20), (2, 1:20) ]" which would correspond to the indexes [ (1,1,0), (1,2,0) ... (1,20,0) (2,1,0) ... (2,20,0) ].

Definition at line 190 of file nnet-common.cc.

References rnnlm::i, KALDI_ASSERT, Index::n, Index::t, and Index::x.

Referenced by IoSpecification::Print(), and PrintCindexes().

191  {
192  if (indexes.empty()) {
193  os << "[ ]";
194  return;
195  }
196  // range_starts will be the starts of ranges (with consecutive t values and
197  // the same n value and zero x values) that we compactly print. we'll append
198  // "end" to range_starts for convenience.n
199  std::vector<int32> range_starts;
200  int32 cur_start = 0, end = indexes.size();
201  for (int32 i = cur_start; i < end; i++) {
202  const Index &index = indexes[i];
203  if (i > cur_start &&
204  (index.t != indexes[i-1].t + 1 ||
205  index.n != indexes[i-1].n ||
206  index.x != indexes[i-1].x)) {
207  range_starts.push_back(cur_start);
208  cur_start = i;
209  }
210  }
211  range_starts.push_back(cur_start);
212  range_starts.push_back(end);
213  os << "[";
214  int32 num_ranges = range_starts.size() - 1;
215  for (int32 r = 0; r < num_ranges; r++) {
216  int32 range_start = range_starts[r], range_end = range_starts[r+1];
217  KALDI_ASSERT(range_end > range_start);
218  os << "(" << indexes[range_start].n << ",";
219  if (range_end == range_start + 1)
220  os << indexes[range_start].t;
221  else
222  os << indexes[range_start].t << ":" << indexes[range_end - 1].t;
223  if (indexes[range_start].x != 0)
224  os << "," << indexes[range_start].x;
225  os << ")";
226  if (r + 1 < num_ranges)
227  os << ", ";
228  }
229  os << "]";
230 }

260  {
261  if (ints.empty()) {
262  os << "[ ]";
263  return;
264  }
265  // range_starts will be the starts of ranges (with consecutive or identical
266  // values) that we compactly print. we'll append "end" to range_starts for
267  // convenience.
268  std::vector<int32> range_starts;
269  int32 cur_start = 0, end = ints.size();
270  for (int32 i = cur_start; i < end; i++) {
271  if (i > cur_start) {
272  int32 range_start_val = ints[cur_start],
273  range_start_plus_one_val = ints[cur_start+1],
274  cur_val = ints[i];
275  // if we have reached the end of a range...
276  if (!((range_start_plus_one_val == range_start_val &&
277  cur_val == range_start_val) ||
278  (range_start_plus_one_val == range_start_val + 1 &&
279  cur_val == range_start_val + i - cur_start))) {
280  range_starts.push_back(cur_start);
281  cur_start = i;
282  }
283  }
284  }
285  range_starts.push_back(cur_start);
286  range_starts.push_back(end);
287  os << "[";
288  int32 num_ranges = range_starts.size() - 1;
289  for (int32 r = 0; r < num_ranges; r++) {
290  int32 range_start = range_starts[r], range_end = range_starts[r+1];
291  KALDI_ASSERT(range_end > range_start);
292  if (range_end == range_start + 1)
293  os << ints[range_start];
294  else if (range_end == range_start + 2) // don't print ranges of 2.
295  os << ints[range_start] << ", " << ints[range_start+1];
296  else if (ints[range_start] == ints[range_start+1])
297  os << ints[range_start] << "x" << (range_end - range_start);
298  else
299  os << ints[range_start] << ":" << ints[range_end - 1];
300  if (r + 1 < num_ranges)
301  os << ", ";
302  }
303  os << "]";
304 }

1170  std::vector<Access>::const_iterator iter = a.accesses.begin(),
1171  end = a.accesses.end();
1172  for (; iter != end; ++iter)
1173  os << 'c' << iter->command_index << "("
1174  << (iter->access_type == kReadAccess ? "r" :
1175  (iter->access_type == kWriteAccess ? "w" : "rw")) << ") ";
1176  os << "\n";
1177  }
1178 }

kaldi::int32

Definition: kaldi-types.h:47
void PrintParameterStats ( std::ostringstream &  os,
const std::string &  name,
const CuVector< BaseFloat > &  params,
bool  include_mean = false 
)

Print to 'os' some information about the mean and standard deviation of some parameters, used in Info() functions in nnet-simple-component.cc.

For example: PrintParameterStats(os, "bias", bias_params_, true); would print to 'os' something like the string ", bias-{mean,stddev}=-0.013,0.196". If 'include_mean = false', it will print something like ", bias-rms=0.2416", and this represents and uncentered standard deviation.

Definition at line 498 of file nnet-parse.cc.

References CuVectorBase< Real >::Dim(), CuVectorBase< Real >::Sum(), and kaldi::VecVec().

Referenced by AffineComponent::Info(), RepeatedAffineComponent::Info(), BlockAffineComponent::Info(), NaturalGradientAffineComponent::Info(), FixedAffineComponent::Info(), FixedScaleComponent::Info(), FixedBiasComponent::Info(), PerElementScaleComponent::Info(), PerElementOffsetComponent::Info(), ConvolutionComponent::Info(), and Convolutional1dComponent::Info().

501  {
502  os << std::setprecision(4);
503  os << ", " << name << '-';
504  if (include_mean) {
505  BaseFloat mean = params.Sum() / params.Dim(),
506  stddev = std::sqrt(VecVec(params, params) / params.Dim() - mean * mean);
507  os << "{mean,stddev}=" << mean << ',' << stddev;
508  } else {
509  BaseFloat rms = std::sqrt(VecVec(params, params) / params.Dim());
510  os << "rms=" << rms;
511  }
512  os << std::setprecision(6); // restore the default precision.
513 }

void PrintParameterStats ( std::ostringstream &  os,
const std::string &  name,
const CuMatrix< BaseFloat > &  params,
bool  include_mean = false 
)

Print to 'os' some information about the mean and standard deviation of some parameters, used in Info() functions in nnet-simple-component.cc.

For example: PrintParameterStats(os, "linear-params", linear_params_; would print to 'os' something like the string ", linear-params-rms=0.239". If you set include_mean to true, it will print something like ", linear-params-{mean-stddev}=0.103,0.183".

519  os << std::setprecision(4);
520  os << ", " << name << '-';
521  int32 dim = params.NumRows() * params.NumCols();
522  if (include_mean) {
523  BaseFloat mean = params.Sum() / dim,
524  stddev = std::sqrt(TraceMatMat(params, params, kTrans) / dim -
525  mean * mean);
526  os << "{mean,stddev}=" << mean << ',' << stddev;
527  } else {

Definition at line 33 of file nnet3-get-egs-dense-targets.cc.

Referenced by main().

44  {
45  KALDI_ASSERT(feats.NumRows() == static_cast<int32>(targets.NumRows()));
46 
47  for (int32 t = 0; t < feats.NumRows(); t += frames_per_eg) {
48 
49  // actual_frames_per_eg is the number of frames with actual targets.
50  // At the end of the file, we pad with the last frame repeated
51  // so that all examples have the same structure (prevents the need
52  // for recompilations).
53  // TODO: We might need to ignore the end of the file.
54  int32 actual_frames_per_eg = std::min(frames_per_eg,
55  feats.NumRows() - t);
56 
57 
58  int32 tot_frames = left_context + frames_per_eg + right_context;
59 
60  Matrix<BaseFloat> input_frames(tot_frames, feats.NumCols());
61 
62  // Set up "input_frames".
63  for (int32 j = -left_context; j < frames_per_eg + right_context; j++) {
64  int32 t2 = j + t;
65  if (t2 < 0) t2 = 0;
66  if (t2 >= feats.NumRows()) t2 = feats.NumRows() - 1;
67  SubVector<BaseFloat> src(feats, t2),
68  dest(input_frames, j + left_context);
69  dest.CopyFromVec(src);
70  }
71 
72  NnetExample eg;
73 
74  // call the regular input "input".
75  eg.io.push_back(NnetIo("input", - left_context,
76  input_frames));
77 
78  // if applicable, add the iVector feature.
79  if (ivector_feats != NULL) {
80  // try to get closest frame to middle of window to get
81  // a representative iVector.
82  int32 closest_frame = t + (actual_frames_per_eg / 2);
83  KALDI_ASSERT(ivector_feats->NumRows() > 0);
84  if (closest_frame >= ivector_feats->NumRows())
85  closest_frame = ivector_feats->NumRows() - 1;
86  Matrix<BaseFloat> ivector(1, ivector_feats->NumCols());
87  ivector.Row(0).CopyFromVec(ivector_feats->Row(closest_frame));
88  eg.io.push_back(NnetIo("ivector", 0, ivector));
89  }
90 
91  // add the labels.
92  Matrix<BaseFloat> targets_dest(frames_per_eg, targets.NumCols());
93  for (int32 i = 0; i < actual_frames_per_eg; i++) {
94  // Copy the i^th row of the target matrix from the (t+i)^th row of the
95  // input targets matrix
96  SubVector<BaseFloat> this_target_dest(targets_dest, i);
97  SubVector<BaseFloat> this_target_src(targets, t+i);
98  this_target_dest.CopyFromVec(this_target_src);
99  }
100 
101  // Copy the last frame's target to the padded frames
102  for (int32 i = actual_frames_per_eg; i < frames_per_eg; i++) {
103  // Copy the i^th row of the target matrix from the last row of the
104  // input targets matrix
105  KALDI_ASSERT(t + actual_frames_per_eg - 1 == feats.NumRows() - 1);
106  SubVector<BaseFloat> this_target_dest(targets_dest, i);
107  SubVector<BaseFloat> this_target_src(targets, t+actual_frames_per_eg-1);
108  this_target_dest.CopyFromVec(this_target_src);
109  }
110 
111  // push this created targets matrix into the eg
112  eg.io.push_back(NnetIo("output", 0, targets_dest));
113 
114  if (compress)
115  eg.Compress();
116 
117  std::ostringstream os;
118  os << utt_id << "-" << t;
119 
120  std::string key = os.str(); // key is <utt_id>-<frame_id>
121 
122  *num_frames_written += actual_frames_per_eg;
123  *num_egs_written += 1;
124 
125  example_writer->Write(key, eg);
126  }
127 }

45  KALDI_ASSERT(feats.NumRows() == static_cast<int32>(pdf_post.size()));

48 
49  // actual_frames_per_eg is the number of frames with nonzero
50  // posteriors. At the end of the file we pad with zero posteriors
51  // so that all examples have the same structure (prevents the need
52  // for recompilations).
53  int32 actual_frames_per_eg = std::min(frames_per_eg,
54  feats.NumRows() - t);
55 
56 
57  int32 tot_frames = left_context + frames_per_eg + right_context;
58 
59  Matrix<BaseFloat> input_frames(tot_frames, feats.NumCols(), kUndefined);
60 
61  // Set up "input_frames".
62  for (int32 j = -left_context; j < frames_per_eg + right_context; j++) {
63  int32 t2 = j + t;
64  if (t2 < 0) t2 = 0;
65  if (t2 >= feats.NumRows()) t2 = feats.NumRows() - 1;
66  SubVector<BaseFloat> src(feats, t2),
67  dest(input_frames, j + left_context);
68  dest.CopyFromVec(src);
69  }
70 
71  NnetExample eg;
72 
73  // call the regular input "input".
74  eg.io.push_back(NnetIo("input", - left_context,
75  input_frames));
76 
77  // if applicable, add the iVector feature.
78  if (ivector_feats != NULL) {
79  // try to get closest frame to middle of window to get
80  // a representative iVector.
81  int32 closest_frame = t + (actual_frames_per_eg / 2);
82  KALDI_ASSERT(ivector_feats->NumRows() > 0);
83  if (closest_frame >= ivector_feats->NumRows())
84  closest_frame = ivector_feats->NumRows() - 1;
85  Matrix<BaseFloat> ivector(1, ivector_feats->NumCols());
86  ivector.Row(0).CopyFromVec(ivector_feats->Row(closest_frame));
87  eg.io.push_back(NnetIo("ivector", 0, ivector));
88  }
89 
90  // add the labels.
91  Posterior labels(frames_per_eg);
92  for (int32 i = 0; i < actual_frames_per_eg; i++)
93  labels[i] = pdf_post[t + i];
94  // remaining posteriors for frames are empty.
95  eg.io.push_back(NnetIo("output", num_pdfs, 0, labels));
96 
97  if (compress)
98  eg.Compress();
99 
100  std::ostringstream os;
101  os << utt_id << "-" << t;
102 
103  std::string key = os.str(); // key is <utt_id>-<frame_id>
104 
105  *num_frames_written += actual_frames_per_eg;
106  *num_egs_written += 1;
107 
108  example_writer->Write(key, eg);
109  }
110 }

std::vector< std::string > *  lines

This function reads in a config file and *appends* its contents to a vector of lines; it is responsible for removing comments (anything after '#') and stripping out any lines that contain only whitespace after comment removal.

Definition at line 414 of file nnet-parse.cc.

Referenced by Nnet::ReadConfig(), and UnitTestReadConfig().

415  {
416  KALDI_ASSERT(lines != NULL);
417  std::string line;
418  while (std::getline(is, line)) {
419  if (line.size() == 0) continue;
420  size_t start = line.find_first_not_of(" \t");
421  size_t end = line.find_first_of('#');
422  if (start == std::string::npos || start == end) continue;
423  end = line.find_last_not_of(" \t", end - 1);
424  KALDI_ASSERT(end >= start);
425  lines->push_back(line.substr(start, end - start + 1));
426  }
427 }

82  {
83  bool binary = true;
84  Index &index = (*vec)[i];
85  if (!is.good())

87  signed char c = is.get();
88  if (i == 0) {
89  if (std::abs(int(c)) < 125) {
90  index.n = 0;
91  index.t = c;
92  index.x = 0;
93  } else {
94  if (c != 127)
95  KALDI_ERR << "Unexpected character " << c
96  << " encountered while reading Index vector.";

98  ReadBasicType(is, binary, &(index.t));

107  } else {

kaldi::nnet3::kNoOperation
Definition: nnet-computation.h:207
void RemoveUnnecessaryAllocation ( const Nnet &  nnet,
NnetComputation *  computation 
)

This optimization detects cases where we deallocate a matrix, and then later allocate another matrix of the same size; and replaces them with commands of type kAllocFromOther or kAllocFromOtherZeroed.

Definition at line 185 of file nnet-optimize.cc.

References NnetComputation::Command::arg1, NnetComputation::Command::command_type, NnetComputation::commands, ComputeCommandPairs(), rnnlm::i, KALDI_ASSERT, kAllocMatrixFromOther, kAllocMatrixFromOtherZeroed, kAllocMatrixUndefined, kAllocMatrixZeroed, kDeallocMatrix, kNoOperation, NnetComputation::matrices, and RemoveNoOps().

Referenced by Optimize().

186  {
187  // For each size of matrix (i.e. each pair<int32,int32>), we
188  // accumulate a list of indexes of deallocation commands that
189  // are for that size, and a list of indexes of allocation commands
190  // for that size.
191  // For each distinct matrix size, we then call ComputeCommandPairs on those
192  // two lists, to get pairs of (deallocation, allocation) command-indexes that
193  // we can optimize out to a single command.
194 
195  // The map is from a (num-rows,num-columns) to two lists, of
196  // (deallocation-commands, allocation-commands). The order may seem
197  // backwards, but that's the order of the pairs we are looking for.
198  typedef unordered_map<std::pair<int32,int32>,
199  std::pair<std::vector<int32>,std::vector<int32> >,
200  PairHasher<int32> > MapType;
201  MapType pair_map;
202  int32 num_commands = computation->commands.size();
203  for (int32 command_index = 0; command_index < num_commands; command_index++) {
204  NnetComputation::Command &command = computation->commands[command_index];
205  if (command.command_type == kAllocMatrixZeroed ||
206  command.command_type == kAllocMatrixUndefined ||
207  command.command_type == kDeallocMatrix) {
208  int32 m = command.arg1, num_rows = computation->matrices[m].num_rows,
209  num_cols = computation->matrices[m].num_cols;
210  std::pair<int32,int32> p(num_rows, num_cols);
211  std::pair<std::vector<int32>,std::vector<int32> > &lists = pair_map[p];
212  if (command.command_type == kDeallocMatrix)
213  lists.first.push_back(command_index);
214  else
215  lists.second.push_back(command_index);
216  }
217  }
218 
219  MapType::const_iterator iter = pair_map.begin(), end = pair_map.end();
220  std::vector<std::pair<int32,int32> > command_pairs;
221  for (; iter != end; ++iter)
222  ComputeCommandPairs(iter->second, &command_pairs);
223 
224  for (size_t i = 0; i < command_pairs.size(); i++) {
225  int32 dealloc_index = command_pairs[i].first,
226  alloc_index = command_pairs[i].second;
227  NnetComputation::Command
228  &dealloc_command = computation->commands[dealloc_index],
229  &alloc_command = computation->commands[alloc_index];
230  KALDI_ASSERT(dealloc_command.command_type ==
231  kDeallocMatrix);
232  KALDI_ASSERT(alloc_command.command_type ==
233  kAllocMatrixUndefined ||
234  alloc_command.command_type==
235  kAllocMatrixZeroed);
236  // remove the deallocation command.
237  dealloc_command.command_type = kNoOperation;
238  alloc_command.arg2 = dealloc_command.arg1;
239  if (alloc_command.command_type ==
240  kAllocMatrixUndefined)
241  alloc_command.command_type =
242  kAllocMatrixFromOther;
243  else
244  alloc_command.command_type =
245  kAllocMatrixFromOtherZeroed;
246  }
247  RemoveNoOps(computation);
248 }

void RemoveUnnecessaryZeroing ( const Nnet &  nnet,
NnetComputation *  computation 
)

This optimization function changes, where possible, matrix initializations of type kAllocMatrixZeroed to kAllocMatrixUndefined.

Definition at line 90 of file nnet-optimize.cc.

91  {
92  Analyzer a;
93  a.Init(nnet, *computation);
94 
95  // OK, now we'll work out which matrices have all their pieces (i.e. all the
96  // variables belonging to that matrix) written to as the first instruction
97  // apart from the initial zeroing. These matrices can have the initial
98  // zeroing replaced by a sizing operation that leaves the data undefined.
99 
100  int32 num_matrices = a.matrix_accesses.size();
101  for (int32 matrix_index = 0; matrix_index < num_matrices; matrix_index++) {
102  const MatrixAccesses &accesses = a.matrix_accesses[matrix_index];
103  int32 allocate_command = accesses.allocate_command;
104  if (allocate_command == -1) // an input
105  continue; // nothing to do.
106  if (computation->commands[allocate_command].command_type !=
107  kAllocMatrixZeroed) {
108  KALDI_ASSERT(computation->commands[allocate_command].command_type ==
109  kAllocMatrixUndefined);
110  continue; // already leaving it undefined, so nothing to do.
111  }
112  std::vector<int32> variables_for_matrix;
113  a.variables.AppendVariablesForMatrix(matrix_index, &variables_for_matrix);
114  bool all_variables_ok = true; // if this stays true, it means we don't need
115  // the initial zeroing.
116  for (size_t i = 0; i < variables_for_matrix.size(); i++) {
117  int32 variable_index = variables_for_matrix[i];
118  const std::vector<Access> &v_accesses =
119  a.variable_accesses[variable_index];
120  KALDI_ASSERT(v_accesses.size() > 0 &&
121  v_accesses[0].command_index == allocate_command &&
122  v_accesses[0].access_type == kWriteAccess);
123  if (v_accesses.size() > 1 &&
124  v_accesses[1].access_type != kWriteAccess) {
125  all_variables_ok = false; // first access after zeroing was not a write
126  break;
127  }
128  if (v_accesses.size() == 1 &&
129  accesses.is_output) {
130  // the only command that touches this variable is the allocation, and it
131  // is an output variable. (this is unusual, but can happen e.g. if it's
132  // a derivative, but due to min_deriv_time and max_deriv_time it ends up
133  // always being zero.
134  all_variables_ok = false;
135  break;
136  }
137  }
138  if (all_variables_ok) {
139  // Here is where the change actually happens.
140  computation->commands[allocate_command].command_type =
141  kAllocMatrixUndefined;
142  }
143  }
144 }

void RenumberComputation ( NnetComputation *  computation)

This function detects submatrices, matrices, and members of indexes_multi and indexes that are never used (e.g.

due to changes made in other optimization code), and removes them from the computation by way of suitable renumbering. It does not remove no-ops from computation->commands_; to do that, call RemoveNoOps(computation).

bool ReplaceInInput ( const Nnet &  nnet,
int32  orig_matrix_index,
int32  new_matrix_index,
NnetComputation *  computation 
)

Wherever matrix orig_matrix_index appears in the input of the network (i.e.

in computation->input_output_info), replaces it with new_matrix_index. Returns true if it did replace it.

Definition at line 621 of file nnet-optimize-utils.cc.

References NnetComputation::input_output_info, Nnet::IsOutputNode(), KALDI_ASSERT, and NnetComputation::matrices.

Referenced by VariableMergingOptimizer::DoRightMerge().

624  {
625  bool ans = false;
626  int32 num_matrices = computation->matrices.size();
627  KALDI_ASSERT(orig_matrix_index > 0 && orig_matrix_index < num_matrices &&
628  new_matrix_index > 0 && new_matrix_index < num_matrices);
629  unordered_map<int32, std::pair<int32, int32> >::iterator
630  iter = computation->input_output_info.begin(),
631  end = computation->input_output_info.end();
632  for (; iter != end; ++iter) {
633  int32 network_node = iter->first,
634  &value_matrix_index = iter->second.first,
635  &deriv_matrix_index = iter->second.second;
636  if (nnet.IsOutputNode(network_node)) {
637  // deriv_matrix_index would be an input to the computation.
638  if (deriv_matrix_index == orig_matrix_index) {
639  deriv_matrix_index = new_matrix_index;
640  ans = true;
641  }
642  } else {
643  // value_matrix_index would be an input to the computation.
644  if (value_matrix_index == orig_matrix_index) {
645  value_matrix_index = new_matrix_index;
646  ans = true;
647  }
648  }
649  }
650  return ans;
651 }

bool kaldi::nnet3::SelectFromExample ( const NnetExample &  eg,
std::string  frame_str,
int32  left_context,
int32  right_context,
int32  frame_shift,
NnetExample *  eg_out 
)

This function is responsible for possibly selecting one frame from multiple supervised frames, and reducing the left and right context as specified.

If frame == "" it does not reduce the supervised frames; if frame == "random" it selects one random frame; otherwise it expects frame to be an integer, and will select only the output with that frame index (or return false if there was no such output).

If left_context != -1 it removes any inputs with t < (smallest output - left_context). If left_context != -1 it removes any inputs with t < (smallest output - left_context).

It returns true if it was able to select a frame. We only anticipate it ever returning false in situations where frame is an integer, and the eg came from the end of a file and has a smaller than normal number of supervised frames.

Definition at line 188 of file nnet3-copy-egs.cc.

References ContainsSingleExample(), kaldi::ConvertStringToInteger(), FilterExample(), KALDI_ERR, kaldi::RandInt(), and ShiftExampleTimes().

Referenced by main().

193  {
194  int32 min_input_t, max_input_t,
195  min_output_t, max_output_t;
196  if (!ContainsSingleExample(eg, &min_input_t, &max_input_t,
197  &min_output_t, &max_output_t))
198  KALDI_ERR << "Too late to perform frame selection/context reduction on "
199  << "these examples (already merged?)";
200  if (frame_str != "") {
201  // select one frame.
202  if (frame_str == "random") {
203  min_output_t = max_output_t = RandInt(min_output_t,
204  max_output_t);
205  } else {
206  int32 frame;
207  if (!ConvertStringToInteger(frame_str, &frame))
208  KALDI_ERR << "Invalid option --frame='" << frame_str << "'";
209  if (frame < min_output_t || frame > max_output_t) {
210  // Frame is out of range. Should happen only rarely. Calling code
211  // makes sure of this.
212  return false;
213  }
214  min_output_t = max_output_t = frame;
215  }
216  }
217  // There may come a time when we want to remove or make it possible to disable
218  // the error messages below. The std::max and std::min expressions may seem
219  // unnecessary but are intended to make life easier if and when we do that.
220  if (left_context != -1) {
221  if (min_input_t > min_output_t - left_context)
222  KALDI_ERR << "You requested --left-context=" << left_context
223  << ", but example only has left-context of "
224  << (min_output_t - min_input_t);
225  min_input_t = std::max(min_input_t, min_output_t - left_context);
226  }
227  if (right_context != -1) {
228  if (max_input_t < max_output_t + right_context)
229  KALDI_ERR << "You requested --right-context=" << right_context
230  << ", but example only has right-context of "
231  << (max_input_t - max_output_t);
232  max_input_t = std::min(max_input_t, max_output_t + right_context);
233  }
234  FilterExample(eg,
235  min_input_t, max_input_t,
236  min_output_t, max_output_t,
237  eg_out);
238  if (frame_shift != 0) {
239  std::vector<std::string> exclude_names; // we can later make this
240  exclude_names.push_back(std::string("ivector")); // configurable.
241  ShiftExampleTimes(frame_shift, exclude_names, eg_out);
242  }
243  return true;
244 }

void kaldi::nnet3::SetDerivTimesOptions ( const ComputationRequest &  request,

54  int t_length = max_t + 1 - min_t;
55  KALDI_ASSERT(t_length > 0);
56  if (t_length == 1)
57  return;
58  if (RandInt(0, 2) == 0) {
59  // remove as much as 4 frames from the left (but don't remove everything).
60  min_t += std::min(4, RandInt(0, t_length - 1));
61  opt_config->min_deriv_time = min_t;

63  KALDI_ASSERT(t_length > 0);
64  }

68  t_length = max_t + 1 - min_t;
69  KALDI_ASSERT(t_length > 0);
70  }

72  // ensure that all derivs will be pruned away;
73  // this tests more code.

75  max_t = min_t + 1;
76  }
77

Definition: kaldi-error.h:143
void ShiftExampleTimes ( int32  t_offset,
const std::vector< std::string > &  exclude_names,
NnetExample *  eg 
)

Shifts the time-index t of everything in the "eg" by adding "t_offset" to all "t" values.

This might be useful in things like clockwork RNNs that are not invariant to time-shifts, to ensure that we see different shifts of each example during training. "exclude_names" is a vector (not necessarily sorted) of names of nnet inputs that we avoid shifting the "t" values of– normally it will contain just the single string "ivector" because we always leave t=0 for any ivector.

Definition at line 159 of file nnet-example-utils.cc.

References NnetExample::io.

Referenced by SelectFromExample().

161  {
162  if (t_offset == 0)
163  return;
164  std::vector<NnetIo>::iterator iter = eg->io.begin(),
165  end = eg->io.end();
166  for (; iter != end; iter++) {
167  bool name_is_excluded = false;
168  std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator
169  exclude_iter = exclude_names.begin(),
170  exclude_end = exclude_names.end();
171  for (; exclude_iter != exclude_end; ++exclude_iter) {
172  if (iter->name == *exclude_iter) {
173  name_is_excluded = true;
174  break;
175  }
176  }
177  if (!name_is_excluded) {
178  // name is not something like "ivector" that we exclude from shifting.
179  std::vector<Index>::iterator index_iter = iter->indexes.begin(),
180  index_end = iter->indexes.end();
181  for (; index_iter != index_end; ++index_iter)
182  index_iter->t += t_offset;
183  }
184  }
185 }

Definition: mikolov-rnnlm-lib.cc:66

Definition: kaldi-error.h:143
void SplitLocations ( const std::vector< std::vector< std::pair< int32, int32 > > > &  submat_lists,
std::vector< std::vector< std::pair< int32, int32 > > > *  split_lists 
)

The input to this function is a vector of lists of pairs, and this function splits it up into a list of vectors of pairs.

In order to make the lists all the same length it may have to insert "dummy" pairs with value (-1, -1). In addition, this function implement certain heuristics to break up the list into pairs in a particular desirable way, as we will describe below.

submat_lists.dim() may be large e.g. 1024 (it usually represents a minibatch size), but the maximum size of the lists will usually be fairly small e.g. no more than 4 or so, as it represents the number of terms in a hand-coded summation expression.

The use of this function is in interpreting a command to set each row of a matrix to a sum of terms. Each pair represents an input term, interpreted as (index-of-matrix, row-index), which represents a vector that will form part of the sum.

It would be possible to simply pad at the end with (-1, -1), but this function also makes an attempt to pad more carefully so that for the most part, each output vector of pairs has inputs from only one matrix, i.e. the pair.first values are all the same. This will allow us to use a potentially more efficient command in the compiled code. It doesn't have to be 100% optimal. Note: in the most common case, all the lists will have the same length and padding will not be necessary at all.

See documentation here: Forward computation for Descriptors (SplitLocations)

Definition at line 337 of file nnet-compile-utils.cc.

References ComputeSubmatIndexHistogram(), rnnlm::i, SortSubmatLists(), and SplitLocationsUsingSubmatHistogram().

Referenced by Compiler::DoForwardComputationFromSubmatLocationsList(), SplitLocationsBackward(), and UnitTestSplitLocations().

339  {
340 
341  // a histogram of the submat_indexes in the submat_lists
342  // each occurence in a given submat_list is considered unique so we maintain
343  // a vector to count each occurrence separately.
344  // The i'th element in the vector corresponds to the count of
345  // the (i+1)'th occurrence of a submat_index in a submat_list
346  unordered_map<int32, std::vector<int32> > submat_histogram;
347 
348  int32 max_submat_list_size = 0;
349 
350  // initializing a vector of list of pairs to store the sorted submat_lists
351  std::vector<std::vector< std::pair<int32, int32> > >
352  sorted_submat_lists;
353  SortSubmatLists(submat_lists, &sorted_submat_lists, &max_submat_list_size);
354  ComputeSubmatIndexHistogram(sorted_submat_lists, &submat_histogram);
355  // the vector has same information as the submat_histogram, but it is
356  // suitable for sorting according to frequency. The first elements of pairs
357  // can be repeated, these correspond to different occurrences in the same list
358  std::vector<std::pair<int32, int32> > submat_histogram_vector;
359  // copy the key, occurence_counts from submat_histogram to a vector
360  unordered_map<int32, std::vector<int32> >::iterator hist_iter;
361  for (hist_iter = submat_histogram.begin();
362  hist_iter != submat_histogram.end();
363  ++hist_iter) {
364  for (int32 i = 0; i < (hist_iter->second).size(); i++) {
365  submat_histogram_vector.push_back(
366  std::make_pair(hist_iter->first, (hist_iter->second)[i]));
367  }
368  }
369  SplitLocationsUsingSubmatHistogram(max_submat_list_size, &sorted_submat_lists,
370  &submat_histogram_vector, split_lists);
371 }
kaldi::nnet3::ComputeSubmatIndexHistogram

Definition: nnet-compile-utils.cc:243
kaldi::nnet3::SortSubmatLists
void SortSubmatLists(const std::vector< std::vector< std::pair< int32, int32 > > > submat_lists, std::vector< std::vector< std::pair< int32, int32 > > > *sorted_submat_lists, int32 *max_submat_list_size)
Definition: nnet-compile-utils.cc:87
kaldi::int32
int32_t int32
Definition: kaldi-types.h:47
rnnlm::i
int i
Definition: mikolov-rnnlm-lib.cc:66
void SplitLocationsBackward ( const std::vector< std::vector< std::pair< int32, int32 > > > &  submat_lists,
std::vector< std::vector< std::pair< int32, int32 > > > *  split_lists 
)

This function has the same interface as SplitLocations(); however, it ensures certain additional properties of the output "split_lists", which are necessary because of the way it is used in backprop code.

For each sub-list sublist = (*split_lists)[i], the properties it ensures are: Either:

  • all pairs in the list "sublist" are unique (except that the special pair (-1, -1) may be repeated), Or:
  • the .first values in the list "sublist" are all the same, and the .second have a special property [see the function HasContiguousProperty in nnet-compile.cc]- basically that if we list the .second elements, each unique number that appears there appears only in one contiguous range, e.g. the list [ 6 6 6 1 5 5 5 ] has this property, but [ 1 2 1 ] does not. (however, -1's are not subject to this limitation, so [ -1 4 -1 ] satisfies the property). This function ensures this property by first calling SplitLocations, and then doing further splitting as necessary to ensure the property. However, if as a result it needs to split any given initially-split list into more than 2 sub-lists, it will print a warning (once per process). If we have to split into too many lists it will generate inefficient computations, and we will need to extend the backprop code to support more general types of operation. If all elements of submat_lists are empty, the output split_lists will be the empty vector.

Definition at line 469 of file nnet-compile-utils.cc.

References ConvertToIndexes(), EnsureContiguousProperty(), rnnlm::i, rnnlm::j, SplitLocations(), and SplitPairList().

Referenced by Compiler::DoBackwardComputationFromSubmatLocationsList(), and UnitTestSplitLocationsBackward().

472  std::vector<std::vector<std::pair<int32, int32> > > split_lists_intermediate;
473  // Split the submat_lists
474  SplitLocations(submat_lists, &split_lists_intermediate);
475  for (size_t i = 0; i < split_lists_intermediate.size(); i++) {
476  int32 first_value;
477  std::vector<int32> second_values;
478  if (ConvertToIndexes(split_lists_intermediate[i],
479  &first_value, &second_values)) {
480  // the .first values are the same
481  if (first_value == -1) continue; // don't output anything for this.
482  std::vector<std::vector<int32> > second_values_split;
483  EnsureContiguousProperty(second_values, &second_values_split);
484  if (second_values_split.size() == 1) {
485  // this branch is an optimization for speed.
486  split_lists->push_back(split_lists_intermediate[i]);
487  } else {
488  for (size_t j = 0; j < second_values_split.size(); j++) {
489  split_lists->resize(split_lists->size() + 1);
490  const std::vector<int32> &input_list = second_values_split[j];
491  std::vector<std::pair<int32, int32> > &output_list =
492  split_lists->back();
493  output_list.resize(input_list.size());
494  int32 size = input_list.size();
495  for (int32 k = 0; k < size; k++) {
496  int32 row = input_list[k];
497  if (row == -1) output_list[k].first = -1;
498  else output_list[k].first = first_value;
499  output_list[k].second = row;
500  }
501  }
502  }
503  } else {
504  // the .first values are not the same
505  // splitting the list of pairs to ensure unique pairs, unless it is
506  // (-1,-1)

509  &new_split_lists);

439  {
440  split_lists->clear();
441  for (int32 i = 0; i < list.size(); i++) {
442  // searching for the new pair in the new_split_lists
443  bool added_pair = false;
444  if ( list[i].first == -1)
445  continue;
446  for (int32 j = 0; j < split_lists->size(); j++) {
447  std::vector<std::pair<int32, int32> >::const_iterator iter
448  = std::find_if((*split_lists)[j].begin(),
449  (*split_lists)[j].end(),
450  PairIsEqualComparator(list[i]));
451  if (iter == (*split_lists)[j].end()) {
452  // this pair is not in this list

455  break;

457  }

460  std::make_pair(-1, -1));

463  }

Definition at line 30 of file nnet-component-test.cc.

References KALDI_WARN.

Referenced by TestNnetComponentAddScale(), TestNnetComponentCopy(), TestNnetComponentUpdatable(), TestNnetComponentVectorizeUnVectorize(), and TestStringsApproxEqual().

31  {
32  if (a == b || a.size() != b.size())
33  return true;
34  size_t size = a.size();
35  for (size_t pos = 0; pos < size; pos++) {
36  if (a[pos] != b[pos]) {
37  if (!isdigit(a[pos]) || !isdigit(b[pos]))
38  goto fail;
39  // if it's not the last digit in the string, goto fail
40  if (pos + 1 != size && isdigit(a[pos+1]))
41  goto fail;
42  size_t pos2;
43  for (pos2 = pos - 1; pos2 > 0; pos2--) {
44  if (a[pos2] == '.') break; // we accept this difference: we went backwards and found a '.'
45  if (!isdigit(a[pos2])) // we reject this difference: we went back and
46  // found non-digit before '.' -> not floating
47  // point.
48  goto fail;
49  }
50  if (pos2 == 0)
51  goto fail;
52  }
53  }
54  return true;
55 fail:
56  KALDI_WARN << "Info strings differ: '" << a << "' vs. '" << b << "'.";
57  return false;
58 }

void kaldi::nnet3::TarjanSccRecursive ( int32  node,
const std::vector< std::vector< int32 > > &  graph,
int32 *  global_index,
std::vector< TarjanNode > *  tarjan_nodes,
std::vector< int32 > *  tarjan_stack,
std::vector< std::vector< int32 > > *  sccs 
)

Definition at line 85 of file nnet-graph.cc.

References rnnlm::i, and KALDI_ASSERT.

Referenced by FindSccsTarjan().

90  {
91  KALDI_ASSERT(sccs != NULL);
92  KALDI_ASSERT(tarjan_nodes != NULL);
93  KALDI_ASSERT(tarjan_stack != NULL);
94  KALDI_ASSERT(global_index != NULL);
95  KALDI_ASSERT(node >= 0 && node < graph.size());
96 
97  // Initializes the current Tarjan node.
98  (*tarjan_nodes)[node].index = *global_index;
99  (*tarjan_nodes)[node].lowlink = *global_index;
100  *global_index += 1;
101  (*tarjan_nodes)[node].on_stack = true;
102  tarjan_stack->push_back(node);
103 
104  // DFS from the current node.
105  for (int32 i = 0; i < graph[node].size(); ++i) {
106  int32 next = graph[node][i];
107 
108  if ((*tarjan_nodes)[next].index == -1) {
109  // First time we see this node.
110  TarjanSccRecursive(next, graph,
111  global_index, tarjan_nodes, tarjan_stack, sccs);
112  (*tarjan_nodes)[node].lowlink = std::min((*tarjan_nodes)[node].lowlink,
113  (*tarjan_nodes)[next].lowlink);
114  } else if ((*tarjan_nodes)[next].on_stack) {
115  // Next node is on the stack -- back edge. We can't use the lowlink of
116  // next node, because that may point to the index of the root, while the
117  // current node can't be the root.
118  (*tarjan_nodes)[node].lowlink = std::min((*tarjan_nodes)[node].lowlink,
119  (*tarjan_nodes)[next].index);
120  }
121  }
122 
123  // Output SCC.
124  if ((*tarjan_nodes)[node].index == (*tarjan_nodes)[node].lowlink) {
125  std::vector<int32> scc;
126  int32 pop_node;
127  do {
128  pop_node = tarjan_stack->back();
129  tarjan_stack->pop_back();
130  (*tarjan_nodes)[pop_node].on_stack = false;
131  scc.push_back(pop_node);
132  } while (pop_node != node);
133  KALDI_ASSERT(pop_node == node);
134  sccs->push_back(scc);
135  }
136 }

169  KALDI_ASSERT(uc2->Info() == uc3->Info());

175  vec2.SetZero();

177  uc3->SetZero(false);
178  uc3->Vectorize(&vec2);
179  KALDI_ASSERT(uc2->Info() == uc3->Info() && VecVec(vec2, vec2) == 0.0);

182  delete uc3;

)

Definition at line 284 of file nnet-component-test.cc.

Referenced by UnitTestNnetComponent().

285  {
286  int32 input_dim = c.InputDim(),
287  output_dim = c.OutputDim(),
288  num_rows = RandInt(1, 100);
289  int32 properties = c.Properties();
290  CuMatrix<BaseFloat> input_data(num_rows, input_dim),
291  output_data(num_rows, output_dim),
292  output_deriv(num_rows, output_dim);
293  input_data.SetRandn();
294  output_deriv.SetRandn();
295 
296  c.Propagate(NULL, input_data, &output_data);
297 
298  CuMatrix<BaseFloat> input_deriv(num_rows, input_dim), empty_mat;
299  c.Backprop("foobar", NULL,
300  ((properties & kBackpropNeedsInput) ? input_data : empty_mat),
301  ((properties & kBackpropNeedsOutput) ? output_data : empty_mat),
302  output_deriv, NULL, &input_deriv);
303 
304  int32 test_dim = 3;
305  BaseFloat original_objf = TraceMatMat(output_deriv, output_data, kTrans);
306  Vector<BaseFloat> measured_objf_change(test_dim),
307  predicted_objf_change(test_dim);
308  for (int32 i = 0; i < test_dim; i++) {
309  CuMatrix<BaseFloat> perturbed_input_data(num_rows, input_dim),
310  perturbed_output_data(num_rows, output_dim);
311  perturbed_input_data.SetRandn();
312  perturbed_input_data.Scale(perturb_delta);
313  // at this point, perturbed_input_data contains the offset at the input data.
314  predicted_objf_change(i) = TraceMatMat(perturbed_input_data, input_deriv,
315  kTrans);
316  perturbed_input_data.AddMat(1.0, input_data);
317  c.Propagate(NULL, perturbed_input_data, &perturbed_output_data);
318  measured_objf_change(i) = TraceMatMat(output_deriv, perturbed_output_data,
319  kTrans) - original_objf;
320  }
321  KALDI_LOG << "Predicted objf-change = " << predicted_objf_change;
322  KALDI_LOG << "Measured objf-change = " << measured_objf_change;
323  BaseFloat threshold = 0.1;
324  bool ans = ApproxEqual(predicted_objf_change, measured_objf_change, threshold);
325  if (!ans)
326  KALDI_WARN << "Data-derivative test failed, component-type="
327  << c.Type() << ", input-dim=" << input_dim
328  << ", output-dim=" << output_dim;
329  if (c.Type() == "NormalizeComponent" && input_dim == 1) {
330  // derivatives are mathematically zero, but the measured and predicted
331  // objf have different roundoff and the relative differences are large.
332  // this is not unexpected.
333  KALDI_LOG << "Accepting deriv differences since it is NormalizeComponent "
334  << "with dim=1.";
335  return true;
336  }
337  return ans;
338 }

353  // nothing to test.

370  UpdatableComponent *uc_copy = dynamic_cast<UpdatableComponent*>(c_copy);
371  KALDI_ASSERT(uc != NULL && uc_copy != NULL);
372  if (test_derivative) {
373  bool is_gradient = true;
374  uc_copy->SetZero(is_gradient);
375  }
376

379  ((properties & kBackpropNeedsInput) ? input_data : empty_mat),
380  ((properties & kBackpropNeedsOutput) ? output_data : empty_mat),
381  output_deriv, c_copy,
382  (RandInt(0, 1) == 0 ? &input_deriv : NULL));
383 
384  if (!test_derivative) { // Just testing that the model update is downhill.
385  CuMatrix<BaseFloat> new_output_data(num_rows, output_dim);
386  c_copy->Propagate(NULL, input_data, &new_output_data);
387 
388  BaseFloat new_objf = TraceMatMat(output_deriv, new_output_data, kTrans);
389  bool ans = (new_objf > original_objf);
390  if (!ans) {
391  KALDI_WARN << "After update, new objf is not better than the original objf: "
392  << new_objf << " <= " << original_objf;
393  }
394  delete c_copy;
395  return ans;
396  } else {
397  // check that the model derivative is accurate.
398  int32 test_dim = 3;
399 
400  Vector<BaseFloat> measured_objf_change(test_dim),
401  predicted_objf_change(test_dim);
402  for (int32 i = 0; i < test_dim; i++) {
403  CuMatrix<BaseFloat> perturbed_output_data(num_rows, output_dim);
404  Component *c_perturbed = c.Copy();
405  UpdatableComponent *uc_perturbed =
406  dynamic_cast<UpdatableComponent*>(c_perturbed);
407  KALDI_ASSERT(uc_perturbed != NULL);
408  uc_perturbed->PerturbParams(perturb_delta);
409 
410  predicted_objf_change(i) = uc_copy->DotProduct(*uc_perturbed) -
411  uc_copy->DotProduct(*uc);
412  c_perturbed->Propagate(NULL, input_data, &perturbed_output_data);
413  measured_objf_change(i) = TraceMatMat(output_deriv, perturbed_output_data,
414  kTrans) - original_objf;
415  delete c_perturbed;
416  }
417  KALDI_LOG << "Predicted objf-change = " << predicted_objf_change;
418  KALDI_LOG << "Measured objf-change = " << measured_objf_change;
419  BaseFloat threshold = 0.1;
420 
421  bool ans = ApproxEqual(predicted_objf_change, measured_objf_change,
422  threshold);
423  if (!ans)
424  KALDI_WARN << "Model-derivative test failed, component-type="
425  << c.Type() << ", input-dim=" << input_dim
426  << ", output-dim=" << output_dim;
427  delete c_copy;
428  return ans;
429  }

263  c_copy,
264  &input_deriv2);
265  // test backprop in place, if supported.
266  if (properties & kBackpropInPlace) {

278  if (properties & kBackpropInPlace)

27  std::string str;

32  KALDI_ASSERT(status);
33 
34  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.HasUnusedValues());
35  std::string str_value;
36  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.GetValue("xx", &str_value));
37  KALDI_ASSERT(str_value == "yyy");
38  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.HasUnusedValues());
39  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.GetValue("foo", &str_value));
40  KALDI_ASSERT(str_value == "bar");
41  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.HasUnusedValues());
42  KALDI_ASSERT(!cfl.GetValue("xy", &str_value));
43  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.GetValue("baz", &str_value));
44  KALDI_ASSERT(str_value == "123");

47  KALDI_ASSERT(!cfl.GetValue("xx", &int_values));
48  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.GetValue("baz", &int_values));
49  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.HasUnusedValues());

51  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.GetValue("ba", &int_values));
52  KALDI_ASSERT(int_values.size() == 2 && int_values[0] == 1 && int_values[1] == 2);
53  KALDI_ASSERT(!cfl.HasUnusedValues());
54  }
55

57  ConfigLine cfl;
58  str = "baz=x y z pp = qq ab =cd ac= bd";
59  KALDI_ASSERT(!cfl.ParseLine(str));
60  }
61  {
62  ConfigLine cfl;
63  str = "baz=x y z pp = qq ab=cd ac=bd";
64  KALDI_ASSERT(!cfl.ParseLine(str));
65  }

67  ConfigLine cfl;
68  str = "baz";
69  KALDI_ASSERT(!cfl.ParseLine(str));
70  }
71  {
72  ConfigLine cfl;
73  str = "a=b baz";
74  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.ParseLine(str) && cfl.UnusedValues() == "a=b baz");
75  }

77  ConfigLine cfl;

79  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.ParseLine(str) && cfl.UnusedValues() == "a=b baz");
80  }
81  {
82  ConfigLine cfl;
83  str = "a=b =c";
84  KALDI_ASSERT(!cfl.ParseLine(str));
85  }
86  {
87  ConfigLine cfl;
88  str = "baz='x y z' pp=qq ab=cd ac=bd";
89  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.ParseLine(str));
90  std::string str_value;
91  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.GetValue("baz", &str_value));
92  KALDI_ASSERT(str_value == "x y z");
93  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.GetValue("pp", &str_value));
94  KALDI_ASSERT(str_value == "qq");
95  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.UnusedValues() == "ab=cd ac=bd");
96  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.GetValue("ab", &str_value));
97  KALDI_ASSERT(str_value == "cd");
98  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.UnusedValues() == "ac=bd");
99  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.HasUnusedValues());
100  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.GetValue("ac", &str_value));
101  KALDI_ASSERT(str_value == "bd");
102  KALDI_ASSERT(!cfl.HasUnusedValues());
103  }
104 
105  {
106  ConfigLine cfl;
107  str = "baz= pp = qq flag=t ";
108  KALDI_ASSERT(!cfl.ParseLine(str));
109  }
110  {
111  ConfigLine cfl;
112  str = " baz= pp=qq flag=t ";
113  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.ParseLine(str));
114 
115  std::string str_value;
116  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.GetValue("baz", &str_value));
117  KALDI_ASSERT(str_value == "");
118  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.GetValue("pp", &str_value));
119  KALDI_ASSERT(str_value == "qq");
120  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.HasUnusedValues());
121  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.GetValue("flag", &str_value));
122  KALDI_ASSERT(str_value == "t");
123  KALDI_ASSERT(!cfl.HasUnusedValues());
124 
125  bool bool_value = false;
126  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.GetValue("flag", &bool_value));
127  KALDI_ASSERT(bool_value);
128  }
129 
130  {
131  ConfigLine cfl;
132  str = "_baz=a -pp=qq";
133  KALDI_ASSERT(!cfl.ParseLine(str));
134  }
135  {
136  ConfigLine cfl;
137  str = "0baz=a pp=qq";
138  KALDI_ASSERT(!cfl.ParseLine(str));
139  }
140  {
141  ConfigLine cfl;
142  str = "-baz=a pp=qq";
143  KALDI_ASSERT(!cfl.ParseLine(str));
144  }
145  {
146  ConfigLine cfl;
147  str = "_baz'=a pp=qq";
148  KALDI_ASSERT(!cfl.ParseLine(str));
149  }
150  {
151  ConfigLine cfl;
152  str = "baz=g";
153  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.ParseLine(str));
154  bool flag;
155  KALDI_ASSERT(!cfl.GetValue("baz", &flag));
156  }
157  {
158  ConfigLine cfl;
159  str = "_baz1=a pp=qq";
160  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.ParseLine(str));
161 
162  std::string str_value;
163  KALDI_ASSERT(cfl.GetValue("_baz1", &str_value));
164  }
165 }

229  bool ans = HasContiguousProperty(indexes, &reverse_indexes);
230  if (ans) { // has contiguous property -> EnsureContiguousProperty should do
231  // nothing.
232  std::vector<std::vector<int32> > indexes_split;
233  EnsureContiguousProperty(indexes, &indexes_split);
234  if (indexes.size() == 0 ||
235  *std::max_element(indexes.begin(), indexes.end()) == -1) {
236  KALDI_ASSERT(indexes_split.size() == 0);
237  } else {
238  KALDI_ASSERT(indexes_split.size() == 1 &&
239  indexes_split[0] == indexes);
240  }
241  } else {
242  std::vector<std::vector<int32> > indexes_split;
243  EnsureContiguousProperty(indexes, &indexes_split);
244  KALDI_ASSERT(indexes_split.size() > 1);
245  for (int32 i = 0; i < indexes.size(); i++) {
246  int32 this_val = indexes[i];
247  bool found = (this_val == -1); // not looking for anything if
248  // this_val is -1.
249  for (int32 j = 0; j < indexes_split.size(); j++) {
250  if (found) {
251  KALDI_ASSERT(indexes_split[j][i] == -1);
252  } else {
253  if (indexes_split[j][i] == this_val) {
254  found = true;
255  } else {
256  KALDI_ASSERT(indexes_split[j][i] == -1);
257  }
258  }
259  }
260  KALDI_ASSERT(found);
261  for (int32 j = 0; j < indexes_split.size(); j++) {
262  KALDI_ASSERT(indexes_split[j].size() == indexes.size() &&
263  HasContiguousProperty(indexes_split[j], &reverse_indexes));
264  }
265  }
266  }

197  if (indexes[i] != -1) {
198  bool found_not_same = false;
199  for (int32 j = i + 1; j < size; j++) {
200  if (indexes[j] != indexes[i]) found_not_same = true;
201  else if (found_not_same) found_example = true; // found something like x y x.
202  }
203  }
204  }

31  if (i == 0 || RandInt(0, 1) == 0) {
32  indexes[i].n = RandInt(-1, 2);
33  indexes[i].t = RandInt(-150, 150);
34  indexes[i].x = RandInt(-1, 1);
35  } else {
36  // this case gets optimized while writing. (if abs(diff-in-t) < 125).
37  indexes[i].n = indexes[i-1].n;
38  indexes[i].t = indexes[i-1].t + RandInt(-127, 127);
39  indexes[i].x = indexes[i-1].x;

36  for (int32 n = 0; n < 50; n++) {
37 
38  NnetExample eg;
39  int32 num_supervised_frames = RandInt(1, 10),
40  left_context = RandInt(0, 5),
41  right_context = RandInt(0, 5),
42  input_dim = RandInt(1, 10),
43  output_dim = RandInt(5, 10),
44  ivector_dim = RandInt(-1, 2);

46  right_context, input_dim, output_dim,

53  eg_copy = eg;
54  std::istringstream is(os.str());

57  eg_copy.Write(os2, binary);

61  }
62  KALDI_ASSERT(ExampleApproxEqual(eg, eg_copy, 0.1));
